moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Bc4 Qh4+ 4. Kf1: Still book, white gains time attacking the Q as compensation for losing castling rights.
moves.6. Nf3 Qf6 7. Nc3: Now the threats against the Q gain time.
moves.7... c6 8. e5 Qf5 9. Bd3 Qg4 10. h3 Qe6: Black's Q has been forced back. Now White regains the pawn and retains an edge in development.
moves.12... dxe5 13. Nxe5: White has a huge lead in development and Black is in real trouble.
moves.13... Nd7: ? This is a blunder. But keeping Black's Q safe is a problem.
moves.14. Bc4 Qf6 15. Nxf7: This capture is stronger. Now ...g5 does not work and White is threatening the rook and an attack on the King.
moves.15... h6: Trying to get in g5 but....
moves.16. Ne4: Black is in bad shape even though White can't castle.
moves.16... Qf5: ?? The fatal blunder but if ...Qg6, Re1Black is still lost.
moves.17. Ned6+: First fork of Q and K.
moves.17... Bxd6 18. Nxd6+: Second fork of Q and K, Black resigns.
